title: [FEATURE] Align `FeedbackDataset.*_by_name` methods for better integration with conditional creation flows

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The current behavior for the several `FeedbackDataset.*_by_name` method is to raise a `KeyError` when the entity is not found by name. Instead of that, we could just return a `None` value. This scenario could work when admin users want to control when a new entity must be created for an existing dataset:

#### What we need to do right now
```python
try:
   dataset.question_by_name("label_question")
except KeyError:
   dataset.add_question(rg.LabelQuestion(name="label_question",...)
```

**Describe the solution you'd like**

#### What I propose
```python
question = dataset.question_by_name("label_question")
if question is None:
   dataset.add_question(rg.LabelQuestion(name="label_question",...)
```
We're using questions as an example, but this can work with other entities.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N/A

**Additional context**
N/A

title: [BUG] `push_to_huggingface` sometimes include tags in resulting `argilla.yml` file

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
**Describe the bug**
In some environments, when using `FeedbackDataset.push_to_argilla`, it generates an `argilla.yaml` file that includes tags that later prevents the `from_huggingface` function to work correctly as they yaml cannot be loaded back because of the tags.

```yaml
allow_extra_metadata: true
fields:
- name: prompt
  required: true
  title: Prompt
  type: !!python/object/apply:argilla.client.feedback.schemas.enums.FieldTypes # <-- tag here
  - text
  use_markdown: true
```

**Expected behavior**
No matter what environment is used, the `push_to_argilla` should generate the yaml without tags.

<!-- Since version 1.16.0 you can use `python -m argilla info` command to easily get the used versions -->
**Environment:**
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: 1.18.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: not relevant
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: not relevant

title: [FEATURE] formatting_func for sentence similarity return list

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
From PR #3955, Regarding the relation between the dataset for rag and the 'formatting func'. What it makes more sense to me is to use the FeedbackTemplate with the query and all  the retrieved documents, indicating, for instance, `number_of_retrievals=3`, and then after annotating in the ArgillaUI, when using the formatting_func, be able to make the matches: query-retrieved_document_1-label1, query-retrieved_document_2,-label2 query-retrieved_document_3-label3.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

```python
# Adding records to the dataset
records = [
    rg.FeedbackRecord(
        fields={"query": question, "retrieved_document_1": context[0], "retrieved_document_2": context[1], "retrieved_document_3": context[2]},
    )
    for question, answer, context in tqdm(zip(questions, contexts))
]

# Add records to the dataset
dataset_rag.add_records(records)

```
Then, we would annotate using the ArgillaUI and add the LabelQuestion. So, now to define the task we would have to use a `formatting_func` to create the appropriate data matching the query with each of the retrieved_documents and the corresponding label.

Using a list

```python
def formatting_func(sample):

    records = []

    for i in range(1, 4):
        record = {"sentence-1": sample["query"], "sentence-2": sample[f"retrieved_document_{i}"]}
        values = [resp["value"] for resp in sample[f"label{i}"]]
        label = int(values[0])
        record["label"] = label
        records.append(record)

    return records
   ```
Or yield

```python
def formatting_func(sample):
    for i in range(1, 4):
        record = {
            "sentence-1": sample["query"],
            "sentence-2": sample[f"retrieved_document_{i}"]
        }
        values = [resp["value"] for resp in sample[f"label{i}"]]
        label = int(values[0])
        record["label"] = label
        yield record
```
Even if we could return a dictionary of dictionaries.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

I also checked the code and, for instance, in test_model_card.py, they seem to use something similar to what I want in the case 'c', but it doesn't work:

```python
    def formatting_func(sample):
        labels = [
            annotation["value"]
            for annotation in sample["question-3"]
            if annotation["status"] == "submitted" and annotation["value"] is not None
        ]
        if labels:
            # Three cases for the tests: None, one tuple and yielding multiple tuples
            if labels[0] == "a":
                return None
            elif labels[0] == "b":
                return {"sentence-1": sample["text"], "sentence-2": sample["text"], "label": 1}
            elif labels[0] == "c":
                return [
                    {"sentence-1": sample["text"], "sentence-2": sample["text"], "label": 1},
                    {"sentence-1": sample["text"], "sentence-2": sample["text"], "label": 0},
                ]

    task = TrainingTask.for_sentence_similarity(formatting_func=formatting_func)

```

<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls or  -->

**Describe the bug**
Whenever retrieving a dataset from server 1.17 with client 1.19 there seems to be an incompatibility issue when calling `response.json`. I think this might be a more recurrent issue, where for some reason the response does return with `response.status_code==200` even though the endpoint is not defined in FastAPI. Hence this might also occur with the semantic search update.

title: [FEATURE] add `limit` argument to `pull()` method `RemoteFeedbackDataset`

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Since we currently have support for the metadata and filters, I think it makes sense to allow for a `limit` when having `pull` because we might want to x-first record given a sort. Also, this might be relevant for other scenario's.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
```python
import argilla as rg

ds = rg.FeedbackDataset.from_argilla(...)
ds_local_limit = ds.pull(limit=100)
assert len(ds_local_limit.records) <= 100
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Pulling everything and filtering after.

**Additional context**
N.A.

This PR add support to `include=vectors` and `include=vectors:vector_settings_id_01,vector_settings_id_02` parameters in the following endpoints:
* `GET /api/v1/datasets/:dataset_id/records`
* `GET /api/v1/me/datasets/:dataset_id/records`
* `GET /api/v1/me/datasets/:dataset_id/records/search`

Possible improvements to this PR:
- [x] Use vector names instead of vector settings ids for `include` like `include=vectors:vector_name_01,vector_name_02`.

title: [FEATURE] create `metrics` module

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Problem Description:**
I believe that users are looking for basic metrics related to annotators.

**Solution Proposal:**

*Metrics for Annotator Suggestions vs. Responses*
We should be able to obtain metrics for individual questions or sets of questions, depending on the nature of the questions. The desired annotation metrics include:

- For LabelQuestion and MultiLabelQuestion:
    - F1 score
    - Accuracy
    - Recall
    - Precision
    - Confusion matrix

- For RatingQuestion (considering differences between max_rating and min_rating):
    - There is correlation to the ranks so x+1 is a worse mistake than x+2
    - Comparable to LabelQuestions

- For RankingQuestion (addressing ranking ties):
    - Comparable with LabelQuestions

- For TextQuestion (focusing on text-based metrics):
    - BLEU
    - ROUGE
    - Edit distance (e.g., Levenshtein)
    - LLM-specific metrics may also be considered

*Metrics for Unified Responses and Suggestions*
In addition to annotator-specific metrics, we need to unify metrics based on the criteria defined in the [documentation](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/practical_guides/collect_responses.html#unifying-disagreements) to ensure a consistent view of the data. This applies to LabelQuestion, MultiLabelQuestion, RatingQuestion, and RankingQuestion.

For TextQuestion, we cannot directly unify written texts. However, responses can be unified using a disagreement approach, averaging the responses during metric computation.

**Code Implementation:**
The proposed code snippet for achieving this functionality:

```python
import argilla as rg

rg.FeedbackDataset.unify_responses("<question_name>", "<metric_name>")
```

**Inter-Annotator Agreement:**
To gather information on inter-annotator agreements, we can refer to the metrics used in the Toloka's crowd-kit for various question types:

- LabelQuestion and RatingQuestion: [Categorical Responses](https://github.com/Toloka/crowd-kit#categorical-responses)
- MultiLabelQuestion: [Multi-Label Responses](https://github.com/Toloka/crowd-kit#multi-label-responses)
- RankingQuestion: [Pairwise Comparisons](https://github.com/Toloka/crowd-kit#pairwise-comparisons)
- TextQuestion: [Textual Responses](https://github.com/Toloka/crowd-kit#textual-responses)

These concepts can be integrated into the FeedbackDataset class using the following code:

```python
import argilla as rg

rg.FeedbackDataset.compute_metrics("<question_name>", "<metric_name>")
```

Alternatively, the metrics can be implemented as a separate module:

```python
from argilla.feedback.metrics import Metrics

Metrics(ds, "<question_name>", "<metric_name>")
```

**Alternatives Considered:**
None mentioned.

**Additional Context:**
No additional context provided.

<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls or  -->

**Describe the bug**
When using ArgillaTrainer with a dataset created manually for QA with transformers framework, ArgillaTrainer returns a key error.  

**Stacktrace and Code to create the bug**
```python
import argilla as rg
from datasets import load_dataset
from argilla.feedback import ArgillaTrainer, TrainingTask

# dataset_from_argilla = rg.FeedbackDataset.from_huggingface("argilla/squad") # this works just fine as it is have an argilla.yaml file

ds_hf = load_dataset("argilla/squad", split="train").shard(num_shards=10000, index=1)
dataset = rg.FeedbackDataset.for_question_answering()
dataset.fields.append(rg.TextField(name="answer"))
records = [rg.FeedbackRecord(
    fields={"question": item["question"],
            "context": item["context"],
            "answer": item["answer"][0]["value"]}
  ) for item in ds_hf
]
dataset.add_records(records)
task = TrainingTask.for_question_answering(question=dataset.field_by_name("question"),
                                           context=dataset.field_by_name("context"),
                                           answer=dataset.question_by_name("answer"),
                                           )
```
```python
trainer = ArgillaTrainer(
    dataset=dataset,
    task=task,
    framework="transformers",
)
```

title: feat: add SDK support for search records with similarity
body:
# Description

This PR suggest an implementation to give support to `/api/me/datasets/{dataset_id}/records/search` endpoint with vector similarity searching.

Here is a full example working with similarity search from python SDK using no real 100% fake data:
```python
rg.init(api_key=owner.api_key)
workspace = Workspace.create(name="test")

feedback_dataset.add_vector_settings(VectorSettings(name="vector", dimensions=2))

feedback_dataset.add_records(
    [
        FeedbackRecord(fields={"text": "hello"}, vectors={"vector": [1, 1]}),
        FeedbackRecord(
            fields={"text": "hello"},
            vectors={"vector": [2, 2]},
            responses=[ResponseSchema(status="discarded")],
        ),
        FeedbackRecord(
            fields={"text": "hello"},
            vectors={"vector": [4, 4]},
            responses=[ResponseSchema(status="submitted", values={"question": {"value": "answer"}})],
        ),
    ]
)

remote = feedback_dataset.push_to_argilla("test_find_similar_records", workspace=workspace)
only_submitted_and_discarded_records = remote.filter_by(response_status=["submitted", "discarded"])

records_with_scores = only_submitted_and_discarded_records.find_similar_records(
    vector_name="vector",
    value=[1, 1],
    max_results=3,
)
# Even if the used vector is the same that contains the record 0, the search will skip it since it has no submitted or discarded responses.
```

Closes #4020

**Type of change**

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

Tested locally

To claim your Community Growers certificate, please contact David Berenstein in our Slack community or fill in this form https://tally.so/r/n9XrxK once your PR has been merged. -->

# Description

In this PR the `POST /api/v1/datasets/:dataset_id/records` endpoint is modified to support vector creation. The `vectors` attribute is an optional dictionary where the key is the vector (settings) name and the value is the vector value.

The changes included here are based on PR #3799, but only apply the record creation modifications. Future PRs will include listing records with vector info and updating records with vector info, but separately, since a lot of non-trivial changes must by applied.

title: feature: search records using vectors
body:
<!-- Thanks for your contribution! As part of our Community Growers initiative 🌱, we're donating Justdiggit bunds in your name to reforest sub-Saharan Africa. To claim your Community Growers certificate, please contact David Berenstein in our Slack community or fill in this form https://tally.so/r/n9XrxK once your PR has been merged. -->

# Description

This PR updates the endpoint `POST /api/me/datasets/:dataset_id/records/search` to accept vector searches:
```bash
POST /api/me/datasets/:dataset_id/records/search
{
  "query": {
    "vector": {
      "name": "my-vector-name",
      "record_id": ...,
      "order": "most_similar"
    }
  }
}
````

Also, the minimal OpenSearch version has been upgraded to 2.5, since versions <=2.4 do not support filtering + similarity search properly.

Finally, the default Argilla search engine is configured to Elasticsearch (⚠️  this change may affect users using OpenSearch)

- [x] Apply most/least similarity order
- [x] Validations (record exists by id)
- [x] Adding search text as filter

title: [FEATURE] create default `text_descriptives` as metadata via `client.feedback.integrations` module

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: team: ml
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the Machine Learning (ML) team

labels.name: team: interns
labels.description: Indicates that the issue or pull request is owned by the machine learning interns team

body:
<!--  Ask David for help you to contribute https://calendly.com/argilla-office-hours/30min or feel free to submit a pull request straight away: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pulls If you'd like to discuss your feature request or specific needs with our product team, contact Natalia Elvira in our slack community or book a slot with her: https://calendly.com/natalia-elvira/30min -->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
There is sometimes too much complexity in the configuration of the FeedbackDataset using the low-level API, therefore we want to have some utils modules to guide users with an easy high-level definition of generally useful features. One of these features is the usage of basic [text descriptives](https://github.com/HLasse/TextDescriptives) as metadata for `TextFields` in the `FeedbackDataset` that highlight general info. Note that we released the metadata in `argilla==1.18`.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Instead of manually configuring this, the API should handle 2 basic scenarios for [metadata properties](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/practical_guides/create_dataset.html#define-metadata-properties). 
- Add `text-descriptives` as metadata-properties to dataset configuration.
- Add `text-descriptives` as metadata to a list of records.

For `text-descriptives` these are the things we can set:

**Language**, spaCy available models: 
df = td.extract_metrics(text=text, spacy_model="en_core_web_lg")

**Metrics**: 
```python
{'quality', 'readability', 'all', 'descriptive_stats', 'dependency_distance', 'pos_proportions', 'information_theory', 'coherence'}
```
Initially most interesting default metrics but can be simplified:

```python
{'quality',  'readability', 'descriptive_stats',  'information_theory', 'coherence'}
```

[OPTIONAL] We can also add our own attributes/measurements: for example language with langdetect or something lightweight.

**Fields**: Which fields to extract the descriptives from (if we set this at the dataset level).

**Metadata property**: As this will define a metadata property under the hood, we should be able to define the visibility (`visible_for_annotators`)

**Approach:**
I'd suggest to have different layers of complexity to setup this. The goal is to enable a very easy way to setup this for every user and give full configuration abilities to more expert users. These can be defaults:

- Our recommended selection of metrics (e.g., quality, readability, information_theory, coherence)
- `en` as language
- visible_for_annotators=True
- Apply to every field

This could look something like this but we encourage you to think critically about your own API-naming and structuring.

```python
import argilla as rg
from argilla.utils.modeling import TextDescriptives

ds = rg.FeedbackDataset(...)
td = TextDescriptives(
    model: str = `en`, 
    metrics: list[str] = ['quality',  'readability', 'descriptive_stats',  'information_theory', 'coherence'],
    visible_for_annotators: Union[bool, List[str]] = True,
    fields: Union[bool, List[str]] = True
)
# default init td = TextDescriptives() 
# separate
ds = td.update_dataset(ds)
ds = td.update_records(ds.records) # or just a list of non-dataset records
```

Take into account that we also need user-warning and errors for wrong code usage.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Setting this up manually. @dvsrepo can you add your code for this?

**Additional context**
[developer docs](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/community/developer_docs.html)
[contributor docs](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/community/contributing.html)

```[tasklist]
### Tasks
- [ ] define the `utils.modeling` module
- [ ] `TextDescriptives` for `update_dataset` method
- [ ] `TextDescriptives` for `update_records` method
- [ ] [optional] add `langdetect` via "language" in `metrics`
- [ ] appropriate tests in `argilla/tests/client/feedback/utils`
- [ ] update docs `create dataset` section in argilla/docs/_source
```

title: fix(API): Count records without (response) duplication
body:
<!-- Thanks for your contribution! As part of our Community Growers initiative 🌱, we're donating Justdiggit bunds in your name to reforest sub-Saharan Africa. To claim your Community Growers certificate, please contact David Berenstein in our Slack community or fill in this form https://tally.so/r/n9XrxK once your PR has been merged. -->

# Description

This PR fixes the count computation for records with more than one response. The change includes a distinct records count, otherwise, the count will take into account duplicated record lines per each different response.

body: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Two minor improvements 1. It would be useful for users to see that a response text area has markdown enabled. Maybe with a [pill tag](https://codepen.io/hyumankind/pen/ExaYNGm): When markdown is rendered it can be obvious (but not always): When on focus on is less obvious: 2. Give a more explicit preview option (as we do for guidelines, could we reuse that?), currently users need to know that if they click outside (remove focus) they'll see the markdown rendered.
